Song.title: Angels We Have Heard On High

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: [F]Angels [F/D]we have [F/Bb]heard [Bb]on h[F]igh [F]Sweet[C]ly s[F]ing[Dm/G]ing o[C]’re the pl[F]ains [F]And the [F/D]mountains [F/Bb]in [Bb] rep[F]ly [F]Ech[C]o b[F]ack [Dm/G]their j[C]oyous str[F]ains
Refrain: Gl[F]o—[Dm]— —[Bb/G]— —[C]— —[F]— —[Bb]— —[Csus]— —[C]ria [F]In [C]ex[F]cel[Bb]sis [F]De—[C]o (repeat)
VERSE 2: [F]Shepherds [F/D]why this [F/Bb]jub—[Bb]i—l[F]ee [F]Why y[C]our j[F]oyous st[Dm/G]rains p[C]rol[F]ong [F]Say what [F/D]may the [F/Bb]tid—[Bb]ings [F]be [F]Which [C]insp[F]ire your [Dm/G]heaven[C]ly s[F]ong
VERSE 3: [F]Come to [F/D]Bethle[F/Bb]hem [Bb]and s[F]ee [F]Him [C]Whose b[F]irth the [Dm/G]ang[C]els s[F]ing [F]Come ad[F/D]ore on [F/Bb]bend[Bb]ed kn[F]ee [F]Christ [C]the L[F]ord the [Dm/G]newb[C]orn K[F]ing
(18th Century French Carol)
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 angels we have heard on high sweetly singing ore the plains and the mountains in reply echo back their joyous strains refrain glo ria in excelsis deo repeat verse 2 shepherds why this jubilee why your joyous strains prolong say what may the tidings be which inspire your heavenly song verse 3 come to bethlehem and see him whose birth the angels sing come adore on bended knee christ the lord the newborn king 18th century french carol
